009package Ch03_PointOperations;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * This ImageJ plugin does the same as the {@link Raise_Contrast} plugin but uses 
018 * the one-dimensional pixel array to read and writes pixel values without calling
019 * any intermediate access methods, which is obviously more efficient.
020 * See Sec. 3.1.1 of [1] for additional details.
021 * </p>
022 * <p>
023 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
024 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 */
029public class Raise_Contrast_Fast implements PlugInFilter {
030        
031        /** Contrast scale factor. */
032        public static double S = 1.5;
033
034        @Override
035        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
036                return DOES_8G;
037        }
038        
039        @Override
040        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
041                // ip is assumed to be of type ByteProcessor
042                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
043                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
044                        int a = 0xFF & pixels[i];
045                        int b = (int) (a * S + 0.5);
046                        if (b > 255)
047                                b = 255;
048                        pixels[i] = (byte) (0xFF & b);
049                }
050        }
051}
